he's very cool  his labs are great. but he actually said in class one day that he was so monotone that he was putting himself to sleep. if you take his class  you'll learn as long as you are drinking a ton of coffee

Overall Dr. Farris is good teacher. He has a wealth of knowledge and is very fair. He doesn't give every answer away and he promotes critical thinking. If he is lacking in anything  it would be his teaching style. Visual learners may not find his explanations perfectly clear.

Dr. Farris is really smart and can answer just about anything you want to know about the universe. He is nice and has a good sense of humor  and his notes adequately prepare you for the tests. His labs are usually very interesting.

I understand why people love him  but I have some reservations. He'd sometimes aggressively pick on the kid in our class who'd ask too many questions (fair enough  but I think the kid had some social issues)  and although I appreciated he was honest he might have done more to discourage than encourage Brilliant Professor though  teaches very well

Best CS prof I've had at McGill. Lectures are extremely clear and concise  and Prakash really cares about his students doing well. He has stayed well past his office hours to help students in the past.
Very clear and efficient at teaching. It took me some time to fully understand recursion  but after I got it  it was really easy. IT'S JUST BLACK MAGIC! Final class average should be at least B+

He really has the right way to teach. His presentation of the material is simply efficient. I could understand everything the first time. The assignments and exams implied more thinking than actual writing and were sometimes challenging  but always rewarding.

Legit wizard. People find comp 302 hard because it's quite foreign but Prakash is a wizard at teaching this stuff. Going to his class was an actual treat  I'll take any class that he's teaching. About half the class was done the final within an hour.
Love him
best prof ever
I'll take any class if Prakash teaches it.
Very easy class. Don't skip class + understand A.
Legend
A+ prof. Get ready to spend all of your time on the homework assignments (worth 40% of the semester and are insanely tough). Tests are OK. Don't skimp out on the assignments.
Great teacher. you should probably learn the material before taking the course. Very hard even for someone who knows programming.
Way too hard.
A great lecturer  passionate with what he's teaching. Really funny.

Great lectures  very clear and consist. However  go see the TAs if you have a question unless you are absolutely stuck. If you ask him a question because you're confused get ready for a verbal thrashing.

Prakash is honestly very overrated. Loves to intimidate students  and is extremely cocky and arrogant. I went to him for help and all he did was spit in my face about how I need to pay more attention in class.. I obviously went to him because I didn't understand his notes but he doesn't understand how anyone could not understand his "amazing notes"

Loved this course. Prakash does a great job giving the material life through his dedication to getting the information across. Assignments were fair  took some work  but they were quite interesting and indicative of what to expect on tests. One thingtrusting my interest in the course  I barely studied for the final and lost a letter grade for it.

Amazing prof  really cares about his students. Posts very detailed notes online to make sure everybody understands. Lectures are entertaining and funny. Assignments are very interesting. Exams are fair and the exam material is explicitly laid out beforehand. He puts emphasis on the exactness of communications to avoid any ambiguity.

What a wonderful professor and wonderful course. He clearly tells you exactly what will be on the midtermfinal  emphasizes the most important info in class  and is a very fun prof. He tries his best to learn everyone's name too. I absolutely loved this class. Avg midtermfinal grades were high as well.
Great professor. Easy assignments and exams. Required very little studying  but was still very interesting. Would highly recommend.

Professor McCoy is not the reason I had to withdraw from this class. This class is not a class you want to take online. My only issue was the labs. They were hard to understand. I would work on them for hours and think I knew what I was doing and then would fail them. I suggest at least taking the lab in person if you take online classes.

I decided to take this class on video because I needed to learn but not have to drive all the way to Gallatin. In this class you have to read and anwser questoins over 10 chapters at a time!! CRAZY!! The labs were so hard and uncomprehensible. I would not recomend anyone take this class on video because its just to confusing.
Really great teacher. Answers e-mails promptly. Will stay late to help you. One of the best!
Very helpful...will even stay after on exam days to help with labs that you didnt understand until you get finished.

TAKE THIS CLASS! As long as you take notes and study you will pass. Chris is great at explaining things. There are 4 lecture tests and 3 lab tests  and he puts lots of info on elearn to help you study.
His class is very hard. and it's an 8am class for me so it's very hard for me to stay awake. the whole semester is based on 4 exam grades and your lab grade. and the exams are very hard.

Mr. Beals is an AWESOME teacher! I wish he could teach all my other classes! He will repeat and explain this as many times as needed! Also going to SI is a big plus..Sandra the SI teacher is fantastic  and helps out soooooo much! and Mr  Beals gives you extra credit for going!

I loved this teacher! The material is hard  but he'll explain it 10 times if needed. Regular attendance is vital as tests comes from lectures. He's quirky & fun. Take him for lab as well. Textbook not needed but very helpful. On a side note  he looks  talks & acts just like a young Matthew Broderick (watch the movie "Godzilla" and you'll see)

I absoultely LOVED this teacher! If you are horrible at science  take Chris Beals! He is amazing! Great Guy!

chris did a great job showing you what you needed to concentrate on in the labs for the exams and what you didn't. He walked you thorugh the labs and would help you anytime you needed him to via open labs  phone calls or email. great guy! Take him when you can!! There were 3 exams and a couple quizzes but he gave you study guide for all of them

He's a great teacher. It's his first year back at Vol State in a about five years. He explains things as many times as you need it explained. He's very good at explaining it and loves answering questions. His test aren't bad. Just study the notes and you'll be fine. He will help you out with anything you need and his pretty laid back.
Very Helpful...always willing to explain things in a different way if you don't get it the first time. Tests are hard but come from his notes mostly. Wish he taught A&P2.

He is limitless in his energy and his love for Biology. He is always helpful and always willing to answer questions or look them up if he doesn't know the answer. One of the best professors I've ever had.
he is a good teacher. he is very helpful and always at open labs. he made the class fun and i understood things better than i thought i would.

VERY BORING!!! He reads from his powerpoints and expects you to learn on your own pretty much.. He is not hard  you just have to keep yourself motivated because he sure wont.

Tough class I will have to say. Professor is very vague  and all of the studying is up to you....no hints at all as to what will be covered. So basically you have to know every word in order to get a good grade. Tough  but I have learned A&P.

I am in his last class before he retires. BE THANKFUL YOU DO NOT HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT HIM AS YOUR TEACHER!!! He doesn't stay focused. He goes off on things not related to this class. Typical Charles Darwin believing biology teacher. He is boring and his assignments are incomprehensible. Avoid!
Wouldn't recommend him  but its not impossible to pass his class. I dropped it and am taking Frank and Farrar. Take those two guys if you can.

I didn't like his teaching style. He is very vague when he teaches. He once sent an e-mail to all students sorry missed class I was busy. I thought that was so rude  I dropped his class after that episode. I would suggest another biology teacher.
I had him years ago and I can honestly say he is not good at teaching. I have no idea where volstate finds their biology teachers  but they need to start looking elsewhere!!!

Mr. Schbig is a super nice teacher. He will help you in any way if you just ask!! His lectures are kind of boring  but he gives you power point notes and reads straight from them. all of the test are simple as long as you study the notes given to you. Human Anatomy is a hard class and he understands that. He really breaks things down for you. Great
Passing this class is very simple. Just study the powerpoints. Thats it.

His class is very boring. He does not teach you  he read to you and you must teach yourself. He does not read the lab until he get into class. He will mark off for things he did not ask for on labs and tests. He is unorganized and has lost labs.

He is very monotone ... but he prepares you for is tests. They key is showing up to class everyday  printing off the powerpoint notes  take notes as he is talking  and study like crazy! I got an A and his tests were mostly fill-in the blank. As long as you study your heart out  it does not matter who the teacher is  you will get an A!

He is a boring teacher to listen to. He reads everything straight off the powerpoint. His tests are incredible hard.He will put you to sleep during lecture. I would take MANN over this guy for lecture.
Not a bad teacher at all. If you study you will make a good grade on the test. If you don' miss any days in his class he will give you extra points on your final grade!
He has all the personality of a carpet sample  but his class is pretty cut and dry. Just print off the power point slides and study those. If you do that you should be OK.

Schibig is a boring teacher but his class is not hard at all. If you study the powerpoint notes you will pass the test. I think that most students dont like him because they havent realized yet that this is college and not high school  and that they need to grow up and do the work!!!!!

Dr. Schbig was awesome in the fact that he was incredibly easy. Made an "A" no problem. He will put you to sleep while talking  and has a dry  old since of humor  but its funny. Not a bad teacher for Biology. Would recommend because he's incredibly easy!

Don't take Schibig if you don't have to  take MANN. This guy only cares about Tennessee Chesnut trees? How does that relate to A&P  I don't know. All test came from powere point. And he reads that power point word for word! VERY BORING! UGH  and i liked this subject before i met him.
Lectures are all done with powerpoint slides. Test questions are taken from information in those slides. Good teacher - knows his stuff and explains well for people new to anatomy.

He is a little dull  but a very thorough teacher. He does no review for a test  but his test come right from his power point notes. He is growing on me. He gives extra credit  too. He also lets you know what the extra credit is ahead of time. Give him a chance.

his tests are made from his power point lectures  but his tests did not look like anything that the class had covered. he is not an understanding teacher. he will address a problem that he has with a person in front of the class.

I signed up to take a Science class  not a Sermon that ridicules current scientific theory. His answer for how things came about is   "God did it!". He originally ridiculed evolution but he finally taught some science and briefly touched on Evolution but after class he held a meeting for the religous fanatics in the class to explain why it was fals
Pretty good teacher. He will tend to teach more to the pretty girls in the class and does waste a large amount of time flirting  but over all not bad. At least he grades pretty easy.
Russ was one of the greatest professors I have ever had. He will get off the subject and keep things light. He is the coolest and it does not hurt that he is pretty easy on the eyes.

this professor is extremely easy  helpful  laid back and considerate of students being adults with busy lives. beware that she makes everybody be socialable and participate  so if you prefer to keep to yourself  quietly - you might have tough time. attendance affects your grade with her. but other than that  its a very easy class.
Terrible. He's very repetitive. Says one thing and does another. I feel I would have done a whole lot better in this class if I had taken another professor. Would not recommend.

Dr. Frank is a great professor! His lectures tend to be on the boring side but he tries to make it entertaining by throwing in jokes. Tests are easy if you REALLY study the study guides. Always willing to help and work around your schedule. Always writes nice comments and smiley faces on exams if you do well! He's great!
Great and very helpful. Dry sense of humor  but when he gets down to business he demands respect when talking.

I took frank for A&P 1 and 2. He is a great teacher! Very helpful and understanding. This class isnt easy but if you show up and show effort you should pass. Make sure to go to his Test Review classes  they are very helpful!! Definately recommend this teacher over all the others. I recieved an A and A&P1 and B in A&P2.

Dr. Frank is amazing. I appreciated the stories he told about using what we were learning in his medical practice. His tests are difficult  but his reviews are incredible. You'll learn a lot with Dr. Frank!

Very good teacher  he gives out study guides which are a little helpful with the examns but as long as you attend class you will be fine. he does gives a review class that you have to attend on your own at the given time he gives  but if you can go he gives tremendous hints about what is on the exam. I would recommend him to anyone.

Dr. Frank made my science experience great. He is very caring when it comes to his students. Yes his jokes are old and outdated but his ability to teach is great. I still remember the points he made utilizing those jokes.

Dr.Frank is a great professor.I find it funny that all the bad ratings for Dr.Frank have bad grammar and spelling errors.Study his review if you want a B. Know the book for an A. He is very kind and considerate.

He's really helpful and if you talk to him and ask him questions he will go out of his way to help you. He wants everyone to succeed his class. All you have to do is ask. He's always helpful outside of class also.
Pretty easy  as long as you keep the notes he gives you  you're set.

I think he is an awesome teacher. I had to retake this class after summer 5wk course that was awful. Dr. Frank actually taught me something and was always willing to help. He does not over-complicate things at all. Hands out study guides of what will be on tests and offers extra credit.

Love Dr. Frank!! Funny  nice  willing to help anytime  and really cares! He knows a lot about AP and can answer most questions right away! Gives helpful handouts and all you have to do is listen and study! It was a great class b/c he made it fun and a lot less stressful!!!! Would take him again!
Nice teacher. Tries to make the subject fun and is willing to help if you don't understand. He gives out study guides with what will be on the test. Highly recommended!!!
Nice guy. Good teaher. Funny. Cares about students learning the material and succeeding in life. Highly recommend.

Very all over the place. He likes to tell stories and unfunny jokes....but he's a nice man and seems to care about the student. He gives you study guides before the tests but some of the things on the test aren't on the guide. Take LOTS of notes and read the text.

He loves what he teaches. Funny. Teaches until the last second. His lectures are scattered around sometimes. Very nice and always willing to help you  or answer any questions. Tests are pretty hard  in my opinion. Do not just study the 'study guide' he gives you! Study everything! Notes  diagrams  AND book info! Overall  great teacher. :o)

So I took him for several classes and I always dropped him. He goes too slow and repeats the same stories in every single class. He made sleepy. He also skips around on the subjects too so I could not organize the info in my head... you have to be there  his tests come straight from the notes. Write down EVERYTHING he says.

Dr. Frank loves to teach and it shows! He goes at a pace where everyone can keep up. If anyone has a problem he will take the time to help. I had him for both lab & lecture and would definetly take him again.

Dr. Frank loves to teach and it shows! He goes at a pace where everyone can keep up. If anyone has a problem he will take the time to help. I had him for both lab & lecture and would definetly take him again.
He was very helpful  but hard to listen to as his voice is monotone. I do like him and would reccomend him.

tough  but awesome! helped me realize i love biology with a passion too! but don't be surprised if she picks favorites by the first test  though  that's how she weeds out her class and finds her "star pupils"

SCATTERBRAINED is the best word to describe her. I probably caught her class at a bad time because her dad was about to die  and she probably should have taken the summer off to be with him instead of trying to teach also. Hard tests  boring lectures  pointless labs. Nice lady though

Overall Mrs.Morris's class was hard. She teaches by powerpoint. But some of the info on the test is from the book. So read. Her test are extra hard!!!and thats the only thing that you get a grade for in the lecture part of class theres no homework or anything so you must do well on the test i wouldnt take her again

I loved her who is helpful and always nice~! but ..... her tests were too hard!!! too many questions that she didn't teach in the class. many questions on the tests came from the textbook which is more than 300 pages.

Now  I kinda like her style o' teachin'  I tell you what. She's a bit eccentric  but she's alright. You just gotta put a lil elbow grease into the class. However  you is right about them labs. They is just some long lectures.
She needs to be more enthusiastic in her classes. You can easily fall asleep listening to her talk for an hour and a half!
No Comments

I hated Ms. Morris's way of teaching!! The whole semester all we did was go through powerpoint slides.. The tests commonly didn't match what we had gone through in class  and the labs were really just 3 hour long lectures.

A&P is an extremely hard class regardless of the teacher but Prof Mann was great. Not very enthusiastic but he tells you exactly what you need to know through his PowerPoints. It's all memorization. You definitely have to study your butt of  but as long as you do that you should do fine. NOTE CARDS ARE A MUST! Only used my book to study bones/musc

A&P is hard. Prof Mann makes it easier by being very precise with the material. You always know what to expect on tests. Never a surprise. If you study you will do well. If you don't you probably won't. But Prof Mann is an excellent teacher and does not overwhelm you.

The Online class is great. His test is basically directly off of his powerpoints . It is worth taking his class. He is easy and a down to earth teacher  which makes A&P easier to digest than others but A&P is naturally a lot of material by itself. I am in the nursing program. Just make sure your nursing program will accept an online A&P class.

I thoroughly enjoyed Professor Mann's BIOL 2010 class at the Highland Crest campus. I will be taking him for BIOL 2020 this upcoming semester. He tells you exactly what he expects you to know on each test. There are no guessing games. Test questions come right from his power points.

Dr. Mann is an awesome teacher! He knows the material inside and out. You know exactly what he expects on exams and where your grade stands at any point in the semester. He uses schematics to explain main points and online lectures give you a chance to review for exams. He is very helpful and an all around good person.

Awesome professor! He is extremely helpful and clear on what he expects from students. Didn't need the book. All lecture tests are from his power points. Lab study guides are very direct and helpful. He is very understanding and treats students with respect. Wish he taught Micro! I recommend his hybrid class for sure!

Dr. Mann is a class act. He is very approachable  clear cut  helpful  and generous. He gives you every opportunity to succeed in a tough course. Just study his Power Point notes and audio lectures and really know pathways. He is very enjoyable to listen to and has a great sense of humor.
Mann  is great! It's a hard class but I love it!

Dr. Mann is an AMAZING professor. I had him for A&P 1&2. He is thorough in his lectures but not too much. If you want to learn extra  ask and he will tell you as much as you'd like. I learned so much in this class. As long as you read the PowerPoints and pay attention you'll pass this class. Best professor I've had.

I took his summer A&P I class and just like any other science  it was a difficult. But I did take the time to study and I passed with an A. He's a great teacher. He tells you exactly what's going to be one the tests. I had to write 2 papers  but the maximum length was 1 page and a half. And if you do miss a class  he has all his lectures online.
My favorite Teacher so far! Professor Mann makes this class enjoyable & comfortable. He's funny & class is doable as long as you study. He is knowledgeable & helpful
Mr. Mann is one of the best anatomy teachers at Volstate. He makes sure that you have all of the material that you need for the tests. I will be taking him for anatomy 2.

I really like Professor Mann. He was extremely clear about what he wanted and though his test were difficult they were completely doable if you put a little time into studying. i would definitely recommend taking him  he is an excellent teacher. I plan to take him next semester and wish that he taught lectures at the gallatin campus.

Dr. Mann rocks! If you PAY ATTENTION to his lectures in class AND online he gives you everything you need to be successful. He will explain anything to you  BUT you have to ask. This is not an easy class  AND YOU HAVE TO STUDY! The time you put in will directly show in your grade.

The absolute best professor I have EVER had. He is very intelligent and willing to help  if you're willing to help yourself! I barely cracked open my book  EVERY thing comes from his power points. I would recommend him to ANYONE! I took the online/lab hybrid class and LOVED it.. well  as much as you can love Anatomy :/

Professor Mann is a great teacher. His test come straight from the Power Point Notes. The essay questions for the test come from Interactive PHYS. He gives some extra credit throughout the semester-mainly from mastering A&P assignments. You only need your book for the mastering A&P assignments  but you can use the e-text instead to save money.

A&P is hard...no matter what. But I did like Dr. Mann. He was clear about what he expected. He did not give you a study guide for the tests  but he did tell you what to study for the essay questions. His tests were hard. But he gives bonus and easy quizzes and extra credit. I did not do well on the tests but still made a B.

I took lecture online and lab on campus. Lecture test are not the easiest alot of fill in the blanks. Lab was super easy. I like Mr. Mann and I will take him again. He gives you alot of bonus points as well so if you do bomb a test you have a chance to make it up. This class has alot of homework but not to hard.

There are 13 online quizzes  and 5 Lec. exams. 10 online Lab quizzes  and 3 Lab exams. A lot of info  but his power points are awesome. I hardly used the book mainly just used the power points. There are chances for bonus points and extra credit. He is very helpful and accessible. I would take him for A&P 2 but he is not scheduled for that class.
Excellent teaching skills. Gives lots of great tools to ensure that students keep up with assignments. Best professor I've had thus far.

DO THE STUDY GUIDE! THAT IS THE TEST! Fill it out and memorize it and you'll get an A. Anyone saying otherwise is ridiculous and didn't study. Very very possible to get an A in this class. You won't use the book at all. I had him for A and P 1 and 2 and Micro  got A's in all. STUDY!
Pretty cool guy. easy to get along with. I did well without the power points  hand wrote the notes  got an A with them. Talks real loud because he can't hear himself.

Very good teacher. Read over his Powerpoints and you will pass. ALL of the questions come from that! He has mulitple choice  fill in the blank  definitions  and 2-3 essay questions. Which he gives you if you ask. He also has a review. Study and you will do well!
Horrible. Unless this is the only class you are taking  I dont recommend him. You have to study literally everyday to maybe make a C. His lab is ok  but lecture is just ridiculous.

Mr.Hackney is a great teacher!I did A&P I II & Micro with him and passed all 3 subjects with an 'A'. Very pleasent and helpful.I never had a science background but i learnt a lot from him.What u've to do is study well his PPT & reveiews.He gives 4 quizzes & 5 exams.Pls don't wait fr the last moment to study.sure u would pass with an A. Trust me!
Impossible to pass! Don't buy book. Study study study and whatever you do... don't forget to study!

I HAVE TO RE-TAKE THIS CLASS UGHHHH!!! THE TEST ARE WAY HARDER THAN YOU'D EXPECT THEM TO BE! THE BOOK ISNT REQUIRED BECAUSE ALL HIS NOTES ARE ONLINE (LOTS OF NOTES). WISH I WOULD HAVE READ THESE COMMENTS LAST SEMESTER

His tests are very very hard. hardly anyone passes them. I would study for hours everyday and barely make a c. He does know what he is talking about  but sometimes he makes you out to be an idiot if you ask questions. This is a very hard course. Don't take it and a&p in the same semester! Don't buy the book. Lextures are straight from powerpoint

Mr.Hackney is a great teacher.I had him for A&P I.( i didn't know anything abt biology.I studied his PPT completely and the reviews.Ipassed with an A+.I reccomend highly for all the biology classes!You don't need to buy the book

He is a hard teacher very dry and boring  but I made an  "A" and I am no bookworm. A lot of people give him a bad review becuase he is not and easy pass. Do the work required and you will do well he gives you studyguides. This is college  not kindergarden  it's not supposed to be easy.

He would announce 11 ppl rcvd an A  B  or C on exams  thats a 33% passing rate! Textbook is useless! Never opened it! He does his best to humiliate you for your lack of knowledge. NO open discussion  you show up  take notes(reading off the PP)& take exam. If you request any information or ask for clarification  you do this at your own risk!
This is not an easy subject  but Mr. Hackney presents it in a straightforward clear manner. If your willing to do your part you will get a good grade.
The class is confusing. We do not have a textbook and he does not teach to each student.
I took Hackney's Micro lab and it was easy  except for the tests of course. I had Carter for Lecture...wish I could have gotten into Hackney's lecture too.

He is not one of my favorite teachers. If you like to stare at power points the whole class then you will be fine. He does give you the review but if you expect the test to be worded anything like the review then think again you better know the material inside and out. You will definately EARN your grade in this class!!

He's a great teacher  and he makes a tough subject a little easier. He gives you study guides and just wants you to grasp the main ideas  he doesn't stress the tiny details. He really knows all about anything even related to the subjects we discuss in class. I'd reccommend him to anyone who needed to take A&P I or II or Micro.

Mr. Hackney is a wonderful teacher and if you just take the time to memorize all of his powerpoints you will do great in this class. Oh and don't buy the book. I've only opened up 2 times and could have found the info from it elsewhere and saved $130.
Don't buy the book! Write down all of his powerpoint notes and you'll be ok. Super nice person  decent teacher. Tests hard  but review completely covers the test.
He is thorough  but if you study and keep up w/ the material  the class isn't really hard  I got an A.

The best professor I have had at EMU. He is so passionate and this class is so relevant to the education department. He loves discussion  and is completely interested in his students'. There is a ton of reading  but he has perfected this course so that all readings are appropriate. Loved this professor!

I really enjoyed this class. His discussions were important and relevant to education today. However  there is usually a RIGHT opinion to have in his class  you'll know what it is. Papers are only 3-5pgs and are ridiculously regimented (there is a thesis template). I felt like a was writing a MEAP essay again.

D is a truly remarkable educator. He is passionate about what he practices and it transcends to the students. He is an inspiring professor  and the "writing intensive" part of the course is hardly noticeable  in part because we write a little every day. It is reading intensive  however  the reading is valuable and fascinating.

I enjoyed a lot of the material. It is a discussion based class and it can be fun. (Although  I had a dissenting opinion once and I felt a little disrespected by D. I got over it and he didn't hold it against me). I didn't think we did a lot of writing because it was little pieces every class period and not a lot of big papers. Good class overall.

The class isn't the most interesting but D is great! He's really funny and nice and loves what he's doing. Expect a lot of reading. Participation in class and attendance is key. He just wants you to have an opinion and think/talk about what we're discussing.
He will do everything to help you with anything. He is a super nice and funny guy.
The readings are interesting and his lectures are very participatory. He truly cares about and respects his students. "D" sets a great example for future teachers.
It's 328W. The 'W' stands for writing-intensive

Very good  and very helpful. Most of class is self-graded  and he's very helpful on the parts that aren't. Expect to do a lot of reading and participate a lot in class. The class can seem a little pointless  but it's easy to fake it until you make it.

Lots of reading. You are expected to keep up and be engaged in class. Participation matters to this professor - so if you don't speak up  don't expect to do well. The curve is a bit strange  a 94 is an A-. Overall  Dee asks you to think about some important ideas and engage in a high level of discourse.

This class involves A LOT of reading. In class you grade yourself on how well you prepared for that day. You actually do that quite often. His grading scale is not the regular scale - a 94% is an A- and a 91% is a B+. He chooses favorites. It was an alright class  but I didn't really get anything out of it.

He is very passionate about his subject area and loves for students to be enthusiastic. He wants everyone contributing in class discussions. He definitely has favorites  and even though I was one of them  it made me very uncomfortable. You won't do as well if you have a different opinion than he does  which is not fair. He really cares about the cl

Very informative class. What I liked best was that the class work was NOT lecture-based. It was discussion  but also included dynamic  higher level learning activities. The course content is very useful for diverse classroom settings. The readings and issues brought up in the course are relevant. All viewpoints were encouraged and excepted.
Dr. Castanier is an asset to EMU staff and all education students. He shares information that is pertinent to creating a professional teacher!

Duane is a great professor and role model. The work 4 the class is ALOT but U should already know that coming in2 any SOFD 328 class. He loves his job which reflects his passion for the class. Lots of busy work but nothing 2 major. Very eye opening course you will take with you for the rest of your teaching career! EMU should be proud 2 have him!

I wasn't impressed with this professor at all. He is a very nice person  but as a prof  I was unhappy with the unreasonable workload and how he plays favorites. This is the most useless class in the COE  but everyone must take it. He's not horrible but definitely get in on his good side and you'll do well.

Castiner cares a little too much about al this stuff. Most of the readings are not that exciting  though a few are potentially useful. He thinks all of the reading connect to each other somehow. There is a typed HW assmt due every class. HW is self graded  but is still a hassle. Also  get on his good side and you have smooth sailing.
Best class yet in the department of education. Truly useful material! Thanks D!
Great teacher.

By far the best teacher  and course that I have ever taken in my life. This class is a lto fo hard work but you enjoy it. There is a lot of reading but most of the class time is spent on discussions. Every educaiton major should take this course with Dee.
Terrible grading system. Believe us on the posts here to take a different teacher if you can. I thought it would not be as bad  I was wrong. TAKE ANOTHER TEACHER IF YOU CAN.
Terrible teacher! Will not let you redo anything . She has a weird grading system so good luck making an A in her class. I will not ever take her again for another class

This was an easy class  Mrs. Stephens was always eager to help out in any way. Gives a crazy amount of BONUS points. I mean seriously  sure you've gotta study  but if you take it online use your TEXTBOOK when you take tests  the tests are straight from it. As long as you follow the simple instructions it's not bad at all. I made a 97%! HA!

There is A TON of reading involved in this class. The teacher is helpful and good about returning emails and calls. The assignments are not that bad but the tests are horrible. She offers extra credit for pop quizzes over each chapter....DO THEM...it will help your overall grade.

Slow at returning emails  slow at grading and opening tests to review. Rude  unprofessional. Will not take her for anything ever again. Will not listen to reasoning and questions students. Speaks down to those who disagree with her "teaching" methods and avoids questions and concerns as well. DO NOT TAKE HER IF YOU CAN FIND ANOTHER TO TAKE

I learned a lot but when it came to tests and assignments she is overly ready to give you an F. She doesn't curve even when only 1 person passes. I ended up withdrawing from this class so I could re-take it with a different professor. Terrible online class. Listen to this review and the other reviews on here. Wait or take another prof.

Hard to take as an online class. Did not return emails. Very VERY slow at grading assignments. Assignments are randomly placed throughout the semester. Lets you know AFTER the deadline that the test period has been extended. Not helpful when you ask her questions. I would take another teacher if I had the opportunity to.

Gives vaugue instructions for the submission of assignments that may appear in vaious places. Will give over half the class a zero if her pet instruction isn't followed. Futhermore  there isn't a clear grading ruprick so you will never know how she will grade. Not a pleasent experience.
She's not that bad  her tests are open book.
There is no point to listen in class. I took notes and when i took my first test my notes did not help me. I just looked streight out of the book.

she is the worst teacher ever!!!! stay very far away. she will not explain anything in class or if you miss. when you ask a question she doesn't exactly answer it. the test are extremly hard even if you go to class. DON'T TAKE IT WILL HURT!!!!
She isn't extremely clear  but a very nice lady who knows what she is talking about when it comes to business. I would suggest taking her class..or at least Into To BUS
DO NOT TAKE!!! OFFERS NO HELP AND HER TESTS ARE NOTHING LIKE WHAT YOU EXPECT!
she confuses you when she teaches and her test are not easy & she doesn't like to keep you informed what your work is or what they did in class if you miss a day
Very hard  Don't take.
No Comments
No Comments

This was a good class! I am a veteran typist but really enjoyed the class and learned a lot! I have arthritis but still did well in the class. Professor Moore wasn't my actual instructor  but she wrote the syllabus and information and was helpful when help was needed.

Assignments are heavy and instructions are walls of text. Exams online are difficult with fill in the blank answers that must be exact. This is a good class if you want to be a secretary  and redundant in Word if you take INFS1010  another required class. This class should focus on typing only. She makes assumptions about disabilities (arthritis).

I had her this year for Bus Comm Online  very nice and helpful. The assignments are easy and their are so so so many extra credit quizzes and they have unlimited amount of times you can summit! Would def take her if I could again!
If you want to learn how to type without looking at your fingers  take this class. You will also learn how to format business documents which should help you in your job. Really good class.
If you want to know how to use Word 2010  take this class. Mrs. Moore is great!

If you need a refresher in grammar  this is the course for you. There are no prerequisites for this class  but Mrs. Moore does a really good job teaching grammar. I know I needed this class. I recommend it to everyone.

Great class! There is a lot of work  but I needed it to learn the skill. Mrs. Moore is very helpful  but you have to meet the deadlines. This is good for me because my job is going to require the same thing.

Do NOT take this class if it is not required for your degree. There is a rediculous amount of work to complete each week  all very repetitive. Easy work  but takes forever to do and you must have Word 2012 available  the free trial version won't work with the software you have to install.

It would be nice if she wouldn't be so relentless about the documents and the grammar. I understand your intent  but this is a typing class... Not an English class... If you wanna teach English maybe you should go back to school T. Moore. Maybe then you'll get what it's like.. I hope you have a teacher just like you  maybe then you'll change.

The most difficult part of this class is the grammar portion. After being out of school for 20 yrs  the grammar killed me. If the grammar had not been included (difficult when the class is on business communication)I would have made a better grade.Would be better to take while in English or soon after  not 20 yrs later

Quick paced class  but as long as one does the work  easy to keep up. Hard to catch up (based on work load) if one gets behind. Alot of information in the text to cover. As long as one does the work  not a hard class to pass. VERY informative & helpful if you ask. Patient and willing to help...just ask

I TOOK 2 CLASSES WITH MRS. MOORE. INTERMEDIATE KEYBOARDING AND WORD FOR WINDOWS. INT. KEYBOARDING WAS A LOT MORE WORK THAN I EXPECTED. I THOUGHT THE COURSE WOULD BE SPEED DRIVEN BUT IT HAD TONS OF DOCUMENTS TO COMPLETE. MRS. MOORE IS MORE THAN WILLING TO HELP IF YOU JUST ASK. I LEARNED A LOT WITH MRS. MOORE. GREAT PERSONALITY/FUN!
Bus 222 under Mrs. Moore is one of the best courses I have ever had. She stresses grammar which is very helpful to me. I learned a lot from her class. Take her if you can!
Great teacher! Just do your work and an A is easy!

Mrs. Moore is a great teacher who knows her subjects and is helpful to all students. She has high expectations of her students  but is clear in these expectations. You have to meet deadlines  but this is great preparation for the future.

Mrs. Moore is an excellent teacher. She knows her subjects and is helpful to all. She requires students to do their best and to abide by all deadlines  but that is what real life is like. She does a great job preparing students for their futures.

Mrs. Moore is a great teacher! She is always happy too. Keyboarding is a breeze for me. I key apprx. 67 wpm. I'm making an easy A in this class. The assignments are super easy. BUT you have to do them everynight or you will get behind. Just like with any class  study. Tests are easy. Love this teacher. Take her if you can! It's fun.

This was the hardest class I have ever taken. The work is not hard or confusing but it takes up hours of your time if you are not an expert typist. I learned alot and studied hard and only ended up with a B.

If you have to take her Keyboarding class  don't take the Hybrid class. I thought it would be awesome only meeting once every two weeks  but she isn't clear on how the homework should be turned in. I missed one thing in a Lesson and I received a zero for the whole thing. Very sweet lady...just not right for teaching.

I wonder if Vol State monitors instructors' teaching methods. Five points off for each mistake--one mistake and you go from an A to a C. If you don't have all the documents turned in  you get a Zero. If you MUST take her class  read the syllabus every week  and take every opportunity for extra credit--you'll need it.
Ms. Ruttenbur was extremely helpful in class. She made it a priority for all students to participate and grasp the information. She wanted us to learn the material and not simply memorize text.

Easy teacher  but absolutely worthless. All work is busy work  and none of it is useful  if you are required to take other business courses you will learn everything you need to know. I would not recommend this professor to anyone interested in learning.
Nice lady but doesn't teach anything clearly. Mostly busy work.

Prof. Ruttenbur is the bomb! She is fun to be in class with  helps you with anything you need assistance with  and the homework that you DO isn't hard  but is very informative. Recommend her extremely!
Very helpful and wonderful teacher. I had her for Bus 222 and she teaches other classes as well. Very easy
This is only a 900 point class. 600 out of the 900 points are tests. There are 5 test in the semester. If you do not read the book it is hard to make a good grade.

This class is so much fun. Dr. Espey wants you to LEARN. Which is (or supposed to) be the point of college. He often tells stories  and makes lessons easily relatable to real life scenarios. Marketing is an interesting field  and he makes it more interesting! Don't listen to people who tell you not to take him. You will learn so much!

Hate this professor. I'm a student who loves all my professors. Thought I would've loved him too. He's very tough. Especially with his grading. Took off 8 points because I had a comma in the wrong spot. Doesn't help if you go to him. He told me good luck. Other students have told me the same. He doesn't use technology. A GOOD INSTRUCTOR HIGHLY RECOMMENDABLE FOR ENG 1010 CLASS IF YOU WANT TO MAKE AN A HE ALSO DASH OUT POINTS IN ORDER TO HELP YOU HAVE GOOD GRADE HE IS GOOD

Nice guy. Easy A. I suck at writing and hate english and I got an A. Only did 3 papers instead of the normal 4. Gave everyone in class a 100 on a paper just for having it on time. Didn't even grade it. Gives 10 points at the end of the year for perfect attendance. Very Easy.

He is so great! He comes off as harsh at first. After a few class days one will notice that he is a fantastic instructor that really cares about his students. Many of his assignments are easy and fun.

Strict and doesn't follow his own syllabus rules! Very thick accent and yells at students like we are stupid little children. Overstates obvious things like we couldn't comprehend.

Mr. Osaitile is an awesome instructor. He makes everything relatable and fun. His grading is kinda strict  but he is fair. He expects you to turn everything in on time but will give extentions is he thinks you deserve them. Overall I would recommend him to anyone.

At first  he appears harsh and rigid.But as time goes on you will begin to understand him better. He really does care about students  just take the time to show you care. If you want a Nigerian English teacher who has an extremely thick accent and does not know the English language very well -- then sure. He is not fair  helpful or clear. great teacher  u want to take this class

This was one of my toughest professors at VolState. I had her for American Literature so obviously I had to read before every class period. I loved Mrs. Malden because of her sarcastic sense of humor  but the class for me  was pretty hard. We had four papers going on at once  and it wasn't very organized so I was left confused a lot. Overall  she is a pretty good teacher. As long as you read and do the work you'll get an A. I learned a lot in this class. We only had to write one essay  do one seek assignment  and take three quizzes. Do the work and show up and you'll be fine.
Ms. Malden is a very good teacher. If you do the reading and other assignments you will get the grade you've earned.
I hated english and mrs. malden when i first got to her class  but her hard knock life teaching made me a better student

If you want to waste an hour of your day or you just need a place to sleep i recommend this class because you'll just sit there and listen to her ramble on until you forget the topic of the discussion  she is a nice person and can speak of good topics but at the end of the day you'll wonder why you even went to class that day
Reynolds is the best. Super sweet  helpful  easy class. Very accommodating to late papers.

She's weird but she's not hard. I can't say that her class was interesting or I learned a lot  but I can say that her class was definitely not difficult. She's really weird but she can sometimes be interesting. I think some people are judging her too hard on here.

Reynolds is weird. She gives you relatively easy papers to write  you write them alone  and turn them in on the day they are due. Dr. Reynolds was a peculiar teacher that did not really lecture much at all after the first few weeks of the semester. I ended up with a B in the class.

She's a great person and teacher. She might weird you out on the first day... but it's the first day. I ended up liking her a lot. This is probably the only professor that will answer any question a student has with the correct answer  and most importantly  without the text! If you are a SERIOUS STUDENT and want a teacher that fully understands the subject they are teaching  I highly suggest you take this class.

This professor is one of CSM's finest. She works with her students so they understand the material. She goes out of her way to give students feedback about their work. Judy is kind of crazy. This class is very easy but its painful to sit through. No homework so that's nice but she's kind of all over the place. Not sure if she's actually worked with children before but it's an easy A

HW is assigned often and there are online quizzes. English is not his strength  but it's fine. The class is not overly difficult and is manageable.

Demonstrations in class work 45% of the time. His English is his second language  so sometimes it's hard to understand him. His tests are ALL short answer (*not sure about the Final though.) Many opportunities for grades

Very easy to understand. He had some great in-class demonstrations too. The only things that bugged me were the clickers for attendance. Make sure you get a friend to pick your up for class if you're going to skip.
A lot harder than i thought it would be!

Great teacher if you are interested in Physics. He is fun and makes sure to include the class in discussions/lectures. His teaching style might make it hard for a student who is not interested in Physics. Taking AP Physics makes this extremely easy.

Does not explain his lectures very well in class  instead preferring to discuss concepts over doing actual example problems. Reading the textbook will be a must as you will probably not learn the material any other way. His tests are also poorly worded and described. Would be better if he could actually explain his lecture material.

Spent hours studying. Not clear on homework assignments. Essays graded harshly. Should of dropped the class.

Unreasonable professor who's too meticulous. If you're looking to take a class where you're graded according to your performance  this isn't the class for you. She has a set grading criteria on paper but fails to follow it herself at times. I highly recommend not taking her class.

Shes honestly the worst teacher Ive ever had. She grades poorly  shes rude  if you dont do something its basically the end of the world for her. Im currently in the class and shes nothing but rude and disrespectful to each student. Just sat outside the classroom with a few students and we all agreed shes the worst teacher here

Unclear on assignments. Unprofessional and rude. Grading criteria on papers is extremely subjective. She has no problem handing it extremely low grades for fully completed assignments. Taking 101 again because of her.

Pretty rude and a unreasonable prof. Stay quiet study when she says to study  do the homework and you should be fine. Her grading criteria is not to bad though  gives what you give to her. Still would not recommend her though!
She was very rude and I would not recommend her. I had to switch out of her class.

Horrible  horrible "professor"! She hardly every smiles and when she does it's very rare because 90% of the time she is yelling at her students like they"re children! stay away from her   she give us alot of homework i was spend the weekends doing the online homework  it takes me more than 3 hours   so be careful ...

She's rude and treat the students like if they were in high school. If you talk while she's talking she makes you stand up until she's done. Hate this teacher with passion. i hate her
she is awesome

No personality! Go to class  do your work  keep quiet and you will be fine!.. When she says study  STUDY! A lot of people didn't like her  but those were the people that she was mean to because they did not do their work!!
she knows exactly what she wants. it was an easy class. take notes on how to write. do your homework ad she usually gives extra points.
she was the worst teacher i've ever had. she would have a different personality every day. and she rarely or should i say hardly ever passes anyone! so if you take her GOOD LUCK and have fun
great teach

she has a split personality...friends say shes mean at all her students...i think differently she is nice to a lot of them...good teacher if u want strict and to learn a lot
Great professor she help me a lot   my other English classes were A  THANK YOU

Ms. Serra is not the easiest teacher I have ever had  but she is obviously motivated to help every student pass the class and learn to be a more confident speaker. The other raters said she is very forgiving with absences  but I do know people who were dropped for being absent too much. After all  it's a speech class and you have to be there.

Ms. Serra is awesome. She wants you to be able to communicate well and to pass her class. Sometimes her lectures lack clarity but she makes up for that with plain silliness. Easy A if you just show up to clase  though she is VERY forgiving if you miss (just give her a good reason why)

took another prof. before and dropped because was too critical and was horrified of public speaking. Ms. Serra makes you feel very comfortable. She has a very unique style which makes class fun...Her number one goal is to make sure you pass. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!
Great teacher.Out going person. you will never be bord in her class.

Ms. Serra is a very odd instructor... but in a good way! She is very silly and fun and she helps you in any way possible to succeed in the class. She will do anything it takes to get you to come to class  she even thows pizza parties. This class is very enjoyable and an easy A.
ms. serra is an awesome teacher. very unusual  but extremely fun and helpful. a must have class
Ms. Serra's way of teaching breaks down a lot of barriers within the first class meeting. After that it becomes easy to speak in front of the rest of the class.

As an older student returning to college  she was so supporting and respectful. Since English is not my first language  I had anxiety to take any oral communication class  But in her class she valued my background  effort and my accent.She tought me how to be an effective speaker in the society.
She creates an atmosphere of awareness and motivation.

I dropped this class two times before because I was so scared to take Speech. Ms Serra made it clear that STUDENTS AND RELATIONSHIPS ARE MORE IMPORTANT THAN BOOKS AND PAPERS! We still gave speeches and wrote papers  but I learned how to "mean what I say & say what I mean." Ms. Serra rocks!
Ms. Serra teaches the very opposite of other teachers which helps a lot when learning because you actually want to get involved and participate to get that A! Thanks For everything!!!

Hi Katz n Kittens! Mz. Serra is the BEST teacher period! If other professors followed her exemplary way of teaching more students would LOVE learning. But  alas  Mz. Serra is a cow! No really! She is a cow and oh so totally hot at the same time!! Mz. Serra however is NOT an easy A. She is a FUN A !

Ms. Serra is wonderful  brilliant and HOT!!! But she's such a COW. I've never met anyone who can be a COW and a beautiful person at the same time  but she does and she's good at it. Thank you  Ms. Serra. I enjoyed your class.
Great class! She helped me overcome my fear of public speaking. And she's soooo hot!

Best Speech teacher there could probably be if you are dreading the course in any way. She's really helpful and she honestly cares about everyone. The class should be simple for anyone comfortable with public speaking  and it'll be helpful to those who are not:)

Mz Serra is great! She cares about all her students and makes giving speeches fun! I'm no longer nervous to give speeches  because I know that she cares about me and only wants me to do well. Show up to class give your speeches  and you'll get an A!!!

She's just great! Wants EVERYONE to succeed. Very helpful  energetic  and fun. Helps everyone to become comfortable with standing in front of a room of people and speaking. Before enrolling  I dreaded this class  but from the first day  I got a sense
You'll face inadequate tests that will give you a LOT of stress. No Canvas  so you'll be guessing what is your grade until the end of the quarter. I will never recommend his classes to my friends!!!
Bob Baugher is an amazing teacher. He goes through and explains his lecture. I really enjoy taking his class. Its definitely a good class to take if someone close to you has died.
By far the best professor in my four years here at Highline.

Dr. Bob is one of the best professors out there. His lectures are very interesting and you can always relate to them. He always tells stories that are fun to listen to. As long as you are doing your studying  you'll do great on quizzes and exams.

My favorite professor at Highline! He cares more about the students actually getting and understanding the information. He gives feedback on all returned papers  and he always has them graded within two days. Really cares about his students.
He is sooooo cool  but this class is not easy on exams. Definitely a good professor with passion but be ready for the reading...

I took Dr. Bob's class because all of his amazing reviews- and he is now easily my favorite professor I've ever had. He is so knowledgable and this was one of those classes you will never forget. He has the best stories and his lectures are amazing. Tests are a little long (few short answer questions) but as long as you take notes  you'll be fine!

I enjoyed Dr. Bob a lot since he made his lectures engaging. He also sets up the classroom for you to interact w/other peers. If you need to take this course for credit  I definitely recommend him. Take good notes-it'll be all the material you need on exams. Use notecards  go thru the book  and remember key definitions. He gives bonus!!

Best class I've taken at Highline. I got to know everybody b/c he made us memorize everyone's name to do class discussions. Gives MANY extra cred  so be sure to do them all. Might seem like 1pt doesn't matter but trust me  it adds up. Returns tests next day b/c he believes you should get feedback asap. Read book & study. Take Dr. Bob! No regrets!
one of the best professors i had at highline! so good at what he does  one of those classes you will remember for a lifetime.
Such a great professor. Definitely one of the rare gems at highline. If you're taking psychology make sure to take it with Dr. Bob. Very inspirational! Loved this class!
Great professor. Cares about his students. As long as you do your work and extra credit you'll pass.

dr bob is the best proffessor i have ever met you have to take his class to believe he touched my heart  he does everything possible for you to pass the class he has extra credit and he is flexible. you will love his class
He is really nice professor that I have ever seen. He helps me a lot!!!! I wanna take his class again:)

Dr. Bob is an amazing instructor! His lectures are beyond amazing and so enjoyable. I took both is Psych classes my first year at Highline and I absolutely do not regret anything. He's very organized too! Make sure to do those readings and study those before an exam! There are no secrets! Just read  memorize and study! DO THE 1 PT BONUSES!!!

One of those professors that you'll remember for the rest of your life. His lectures are engaging  funny and packed with information that sticks with you. He assigns a lot of reading and memorization because he wants the students to realize how much they're capable of. Every member of my class got to be friends with eachother.

I've never dropped a class  never not had a 4.0. I walk into his class first few days are good  a lot of handouts given  but i loved his lectures  he made the topic fun and enjoyable to learn. BUT YOU HAVE TO STUDY YOUR BUTT OFF. TESTS ARE REALLY HARD. MANY OF THEM. THEY ARE LONG. If you want a challenge  have him as a teacher. Don't recommend

Dr. Bob is the best teacher I have ever had. He is respectable  friendly  funny  and brilliant. On the first day he gives you all of the essential information needed to pass the class  it can feel overwhelming at first but it's incredibly helpful. He fulfills his promise of teaching you all there is to know about Human Relations. Highly recommend!

Dr. Bob is such a great teacher. Yes  his lectures are long  and his reading assignments are very (very  very  very  ...) long. But  in the end  it is all so worth it. Make sure you know how to take good and efficient notes. Don't be that one student who looks lost during lectures. I would take his class over and over again if I could. Just do it!
He's more of a stand and talk kind of guy. His handwriting can get a bit messy to read

She is a pretty good teacher but the harder you work on an essay the lower your score. I half-assed my last two essays and got A's while working hard on my first one and got a B. She an easy grader for the most part and this is her last semester.

This class is very boaring. Lots of reading. Four essays plus a group project. Seems like she looked down on our generation. Not very helpfull. We have to read the stories and peer edit our own papers. SO just sits their or talkes about who knows what.
Carla is a straight up G. She loves the material  and loves seeing students dive in and excel. With that being said  she's a babe and a half.
lovessss it

Requires a lot of reading. Nice old lady  who respects others comments. I highly recommend if you enjoy reading  but has limited office hours. She will do her best in class to help you with your essays. Kinda crazy lady though!
She is easy  but grades harder than you think. She is old and rather slow  but makes the class fun. I enjoyed her class but expected a better grade than what I got.

She is very enthusiastic and has a love for teaching that reminds us of why college offers just a lot more than grade school. She reinforces the importance of using the words "I" and "feel" which help re-establish the individuality of a writer. She was a thrill to have  and her advice  as well as wisdom serve as an added bonus on her resume.
Great professor. Fun  funny and loves the subject. Always interesting and very helpful. Never a dull moment and I took the class in the morning!

Carla is a crazy little lady. She definitely keeps the class entertained. There's no tests and no final. only three essays  and they're all relatively easy. if ur looking for a fun and easy English class u definitely want Carla to be ur teacher.

She is the nicest woman ever  low homework...she is very understanding..i got a kidney infection in the middle of semester and was out for 2 weeks..i tried to come back and she said "you dont look so well go home and rest" NICEST WOMAN EVER! no tests  midterms  and finals! sooo nice! just engage in dicsussion you will make her day!

By far my favorite teacher. She is extremely intelligent and intellectual. This class is the only class I actually looked forward to going to. Her class has a lot of depth to it  and she makes it very easy to achieve a high grade. Great woman.

Great Professor!!!! Very helpful...pretty easy class..definitley would recommend in....shes very helpful outside of class..very opinionate but in a good way
I love Carla! She emphasizes discussion in class

This teacher will talk your ear off during every class  some of it relevant to the subject. She is pretty opinionated  although she claims otherwise  so choose your words carefully. Overall  she's a great teacher and your assignments aren't hard. It was an enjoyable class.
She is a great professor. She had my back when the campus dean tried to expel me. She is there 100% for the well being of all students in the classroom and out.

I loved her class. She is very interesting. She cares more about your ideas than the topic of English. She is simply amazing!
Very sweet lady  fun class.

Sweet  elderly lady that is willing to go out of her way to help her students and is always open to suggestions. Allows for re-writes and attendance is not required. (Don't be alarmed when she hits her head on the wall!)

Professor Ho's lectures are convoluted and w/o structure. She gives nearly no opportunities for student involvement. That said  she is truly passionate about her work and her students and it shows in the lengthy and helpful feedback she gives on the four essays she assigns. The readings are amazing  it's just too bad we don't get to discuss them.

Wendy Ho is definitely a professor who cares about her students. She is accessible  approachable  hilarious  passionate and truly a one of a kind professor. She takes the time to get to know her students and is encouraging. Yes  her assigned readings and essays are challenging  but she teaches so much and is a great resource. I loved this class.

omg worst prof I've ever had. She literally talks in riddles and there is so much reading and theyre difficult. She pins you into going to lecture cause participation is 30% and 3 other papers plus final. I literally can never follow her at all! AVOID!!! Pretty much my entire class dreaded her and the material.
Oh my god this has probably been my worst experience ever as a student. She rambled on and on n on during lectures

You have a LOT of readings every week. The midterms  final  and papers (2) are based on these readings! She repeats what is important in lecture so you can't miss it! Participation in discussion is a must for points. GO TO THE TA for help on the 2 papers! It makes a huge difference. I went from a C+ (1st paper) to B+ (2nd) after meeting w/ the TA.

She is passionate  but style of instruction and evaluation is not reasonable. No PPT  substantial readings. MCQ can be ridiculously tricky  and the ambiguous wording remind me of SAT. In discussion  you have to talk to get the points. The evaluation of paper totally depends on your TA  which could be subjective. Remember you have other GE options!

Personally  I didn't enjoy this class. While TAs were very helpful and kind  Professor Ho tended to go on angry rants during lecture. She's very passionate  but she would digress from the readings and run out of time educating us on the history. Tests were relatively easy if you did the readings...4 or 5 20 pages readings per week that is.

ASA 1 is the best class I've taken so far. Prof. Ho is very passionate in her teaching  and I suggest you participate  ask questions  answer questions  sit near the front to be engaged in the course as she can go on tangents. This course will fulfill a lot of GE  but you got to work for it! A lot of reading and 2 Papers  Discussion worth a lot.

Prof Ho is one of the worst lecturers I've ever had in my three years at UC Davis. Do not take her class. ASA 1 with her was extraordinarily difficult  and I've been taking upper division classes in ethnic studies for two years. She cannot explain things simply
Just do all of the required readings and attend lecture

Super inspirational! Loved this class  though she tends to ramble on about the same things for the first half hour of every class. Midterm and final are both multiple choice (45 &50 questions) and are easy IF you do the reading. DO THE READING (there's a lot!!!)  though the way the questions are structured isn't too hard to guess. 2 5-7 page papers

Tough class with a lot of material. Although much of it is dry  you will learn a lot  probably more than you should in a single 10 week class. Tests are straightforward and follow the reading she assigns.(which is a ton)
Great teacher to take. Talks about the importance of effort and learning with passion. Love to take another class with her.

She is amazing to listen to. My favorite class ever. Very discussion based. No tests. Three short papers (possibly creative project substitute)  a group project  and two short write ups of your choice. Do your best to read  and talk with her if things come up. She can be flexible with assignments. She's not out to fail you  but you have to try hard

Lectures are confusing and boring  I gave up on going at all. A looot of readings too  however tests are multiple choice and super easy if you keep up with the readings and do her handouts. There are 2 5-page papers  overall an OK class  pretty easy to get a B  if you put a little bit more effort in you can definitely get an A.
So hard to follow her lectures. Every time I actually went to class I ended up not being able to take any notes because she speaks SO unclearly. Tests are pretty easy though
She's such a wonderful lady. The textbook she used was very relevant and great for the class. She was very relatable and understanding.

TONS of readings! And she often goes off on random rants about life. This quarter her favorite lines are "Don't be Spongebobs! Or Walking Dead!" Sometimes going to lecture is totally useless. But then there are other times when she is focused and actually explains/clarifies the readings.

Oh No  forget this lady. She made my life hell. Never take any class with her  it's a warning. Her lectures are boring as hell  she only gives her opinion and doesn't give actual facts. Her exams are stupid pointless  I honestly don't know how she became a Professor  Just don't take her especially all the reading she makes you do is a bit crazy.

Her lectures are absolutely pointless the only real reason Ito go is for the handouts she would give. She claims cares for critical thinking yet the midterm and final are multiple choice. The amount or reading is absolutely ridiculous! The amount of reading is absolutely ridiculous! Trust me and please save your self don't take this class!

Dr. Andy is super passionate about his classes and UCD. Not for everyone  but I personally enjoyed his class. His essay prompts and grading criteria weren't ambiguous or unreasonable. Participation and attendance count- he makes that clear from day one. If you're content to not show or show up with a disengaged attitude I'd find a different class.

Half of class was spent with him humble bragging about how marvelous himself and his achievements are and the other half was spent with him explaining his unclear prompts in the most obscure way possible. He's a tough grader with high expectations so to office hours and get feedback on drafts before turning in your final paper and you should do ok.

I feel like Dr. Andy is a love him or hate him kind of professor. Because he talks about things he likes poetry  film  music and gives lots of factoids in class  it could mean amazing or bust depending on what type of student you are. I personally liked him because I learned a lot during class and office hours. He nurtures creativity. A family man.

He makes a great deal about being in class in order to pass  yet all he talks about in class is his poetry or his books or his columns on newspapers! He spends 85% of the class time bragging about the same things on a daily basis. How he got selected  how he was awarded! The bragging never ends! It amuses me how he manages to sneak it in everyday!
Nice guy. Joined his Freshman Seminar on accident. 3 poems a week  and if you go to his favorite poetry club  he'll buy you sweet potato fries.
Why does Dr. Andy not have a chili pepper? THE BEARD!
Dr. Andy makes this class very interesting  I would take it for sure! My favorite professor that I have had at Davis.

Dr. Andy Jones is a great Professor! He always had extra office hours in Downtown Davis. He is really helpful. Although he is a tough grader  its only because he wants you to be a better write. You will learn a lot. The readings were light  not too much. Also  he's really funny. He always made the class laugh. It's a class I never wanted to miss.

Tries to engage the class  and have them participate which is nice. Really seems to have enthusiasm and want students to learn and better themselves as writers. Can be really intimidating at times and overpowering though  also grades rather harshly so don't be fooled into thinking this class is easy. HARD WORK + PERFECT ATTENDANCE = AVERAGE GRADE.

I loved this class. The class topics provoked a lot of thought and discussion. I learned a lot about my writing and how I can combine writing with my photography and other multimedia work I do in my other TCS classes. Dr. Andy assigned interesting readings. Some of the writing assignments were hard. Definitely a lot of work. Definitely worth it.

Dr. Andy is the best! The class was very eye opening  and Dr. Andy allowed us a lot of flexibility as far as creativity is concerned! The reader is amazing  I will pass it onto my kids. The assignments may seem unclear at points  but really  you realize Dr. Andy just wants you to materialize the assignment into anything you like. Best teacher
Good teacher but he requires a lot of busy work and assignments are unclear at times.

Great teacher! Professor Andy Jones made the six-week quarter fly by. I liked his PowerPoint quizzes  and his crazy allusions. The class is a lot of work  but he grades fair. I really appreciated Andy's wide-eyed humor - he connects almost everything we read to other assigned works  or to pop culture. I would take another class with him in a minute

I learned a lot from Dr. Andy about how to think and how to write. He's a funny guy who makes a reaaally long class (three hours in the summer) fly by. He makes you get to know your classmates  which is also cool. The group assignment was tough  mostly because of scheduling challenges  but I learned the most from that paper. And from office hours.

Dr. Andy's class really inspired me to learn and to think creatively about my writing. And he also brings a ton of energy to class discussions. I can see why ASUCD gave him the Professor of the Year award! Congrats Andy!
awesome guy
Very enthusiastic teacher  very fun and exciting class... had some very unique and original projects for the class.

Andy's one freaking awesome English teacher! 191 is designed to allow you to use and experiment with different kinds of media and Andy asks you to do all of these... butt crazy things that you don't really understand why you're doing it  but at least it was fun and unpredictable! Workload is kinda heavy  but if you keep up with it  you'll do well.

andy jones is an extremely nice  kind  teacher. always willing to help you out. However this class TCS191 needed a lot of work. What are we learning? What is going on? What is the purpose? I have never been so lost  yet not? in a class before... ... what?
Great Teacher  very enthusiastic about class. Can be unclear about assignment.
started with lif  ended with death (The Class)

He was a little unusually but really engaging. Class was always interesting and he held my attention. I also learned a great deal and even sort of look at life a little differently now. It is a shame he no longer teaches.

I was hoping that Mr. Kmetzo was still teaching at NVCC  as he was one of the most inspiring teachers that I've ever had and I wanted to comment. Kmetzo still stands out in my memory as one of the best teachers  even though I took his classes in '89! Funny and interesting person - Highly recommended

Tom is the greatest of all time. The number 1 teacher I've ever had. A bit out of the norm but  ask him what the norm is and he'll tell you it's all about the chairness! Truthfully the most inspiring man of my life -Dean (where are you)
Took his freshman seminar class and found it quite interesting. This was a pass fail class so it wasn't hard but he was helpful...he did talk a lot about his life but it was interesting to me.

Worst prof EVER! Very unorganized  very boring  and talks too much about his damn life. Talks about other BS that dsnt have to do w/the class. Loses ppl's papers and tells us we're at fault! What a butthole! 3 papers only. 1st paper can be redone since ppl always get a low grade. If you're retired (as he is)  DON'T COME BACK TO TEACH!!!

There are no words to describe the torture his class inflicted on me. He is disorganized  unclear  boring and shares too much personal information. The were not that bad but his lectures were horrible! Avoid him!
i regret enrolling in this course. *not happy*

ok so this class is by far the worst class in sociology i have taken  as a matter of fact  the worst ever lectures are so boring and his teaching is so unorganized the reader and his handouts were complicated to find nothing was in order and it was simply just not enjoyable i hope he hasnt been teaching it this way all this time. finally it's over!
very confusing. i regret enrolling in this class. his soc 128 class is way more tolerable than soc 129.

It is hard to understand what the class subject is really about his lec are very boring most of the time he has a lot of info that he wants to share but often are just stories tha tdont relate. no tests  3 commentaries and 3 short quizes attendance counts and will help your grade
